definition: curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)

sentences.english: You just always review on your old little screen.
sentences.chinese: 你都可在自己的小荧幕上重温。

sentences.english: Lots of designers are just people behind the curtain.
sentences.chinese: 许多设计师只是荧幕后的工作者。

sentences.english: When French femmes fatales appear on the silver screen, we seem to be almost embraced by a pleasant fragrance.
sentences.chinese: 哪怕法兰西美女仅出现在荧幕上，就带来袭人暗香。

sentences.english: The time of arrival is indicated on the screen .
sentences.chinese: 盖着显示荧幕的一块透明板。

sentences.english: It is only a screen, often made from calico.
sentences.chinese: 只有一个荧幕，多半是用白布做的。

sentences.english: It makes me lie down in front of the high-definition screen.
sentences.chinese: 它使我躺卧在高清晰度的荧幕前。

sentences.english: Nonetheless, other studies have established a link between screen time and obesity.
sentences.chinese: 但是，其他研究建立了荧幕时间和肥胖之间的联系。

sentences.english: People go to the cinema to worship the idols on screen.
sentences.chinese: 人们去电影院是去膜拜荧幕上的偶像。

sentences.english: What I wanted was wide-screen epic.
sentences.chinese: 我想要的是宽荧幕上的巨作。

sentences.english: Do you find TV-screen fame different from movie-screen fame?
sentences.chinese: 你认为在电视和在大荧幕上成名有什么不同吗？

sentences.english: Many novels of Hai Yan's are make into dramas and play on TV.
sentences.chinese: 海岩的很多小说都被编排成剧本搬上荧幕。

sentences.english: He just needs a big screen.
sentences.chinese: 他需要的只是一块大荧幕。

sentences.english: Drums started to pound, and the screens turned on as if by magic.
sentences.chinese: 紧接着鼓声震天，那些荧幕像变魔术般亮了起来。

sentences.english: Seek an apprenticeship under an experienced and successful screenwriter, if possible.
sentences.chinese: 如果可能的话，给经验丰富的成功荧幕剧作家当学徒。

sentences.english: So I was on a national television prime-time show.
sentences.chinese: 我从此走上了国家电视台黄金时段的荧幕。

sentences.english: The first prize is a big screen TV.
sentences.chinese: 头奖是一台大荧幕电视。

definition: to appear (in a show etc)/an appearance (on stage etc)
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
to act the leading role (in a movie or a play)/to star/lead actor
idol drama/drama series in which the actors are chosen for their preexisting popularity with young viewers
